hints.content: Let's count how many candies measured $21\text{ cm}$.

The licorice, lollipop, pack of gum and snowball measured $\greenE{21}\text{ cm}$

So, we place $4$ dots over $\greenE{21}$ on the number line.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/623c80b36d4d5c88c9fc3c654cb1c6117018a705)
Now, let's graph the other measurements on the table.

Here is the completed line plot:

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/43c60b0a0ede75531b486b802b3bf058d438fb0e)

question.content:
At a party, some friends measure the length of candy.
The friends are going to make a line plot of the data.  

Candy | Length ($\text{cm}$)
:-: | :-: | :-:
Chocolate bar | $29$
Licorice | $21$
Lollipop | $21$
Pack of gum | $21$
Sugar Dip | $25$
Minty bar | $27$
Snowball | $21$

**Graph the measurements from the table on the line plot.**   
*Click above the line plot to make dots for each of the measurements.*

[[â˜ƒ plotter 1]]
